intro: Xyris wurdackii subsp. caquetensis, commonly known as the Caquetá xyris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Xyridaceae. It is native to Colombia, where it thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant is characterized by its grass-like foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers moist, well-drained soils. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
